allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. mental

details.flavorText: Loners at heart, drow rogues trust no one-least of all fellow slayers. Thees drow rely on awareness and adaptation to survive the cutthroat nature of their society.

description.label: Description
description.value:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's level or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}.

description.label: Description
description.value: All creatures in the area when you cast the spell are limned in colorful, heatless fire of a color of your choice for the duration. Visible creatures can't be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire. If the creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}, they are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire, rather than being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected}.

description.label: Description
description.value: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

When first exposed to bright light, the monster is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Blinded]{Blinded} until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in darkness. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Dazzled]{Dazzled}.

Requirement A drow rogue can't use this reaction while encumbered. Trigger The drow rogue is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the drow rogue can see. Effect The drow rogue gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Armor Class against the triggering attack.
The drow rogue draws a weapon using the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Interact]{Interact} action, then Strikes with that weapon.

The drow rogue deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} creatures.
When the monster Strikes a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 4 hours; Stage 1 slowed 1 (1 round); Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute);Stage 3 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1 round);Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1d4 hours)
